revised_title: Friction and Extrusion of Liquid Films in Rubber-Glass Contacts
tldr: The authors investigate the extrusion of liquid films trapped between a glass and a rubber surface, focusing on the friction and behavior of windscreen wiper blades. They study the viscosity and thickness of the liquid films, as well as the role of electrical double-layer repulsive forces in supporting the normal load. The findings provide insights into the design of windscreen wiper blades and the understanding of rubber-glass contacts.
